meanings.definition: To transfer a plant to a larger container.
meanings.sent1: I need to repot my flower into a bigger pot.
meanings.sent2: It is time to repot the cactus into a larger planter.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally repotted the plant into a container too big for it!
meanings.sent4: She repotted the succulent, giving it more room to grow, like a bird spreading its wings.
meanings.sent5: The act of repotting is like giving the plant a new home, a fresh start.

meanings.definition: To report or inform someone about something.
meanings.sent1: Please repot to the teacher about the broken chair.
meanings.sent2: He will repot the incident to the principal for investigation.
meanings.sent3: I will repot to my friend about the funny incident at school.
meanings.sent4: She repotted the news to her sister, spreading the information like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: It is important to repot any issues to the authorities for help.
